com.overturelabs.cannon.toolbox

Class ResourcePoint<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.overturelabs.cannon.toolbox.ResourcePoint<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of expected response object.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExampleResourcePoint

    public abstract class ResourcePoint<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Resource point is a helper class that acts as an interface to a specific API endpoint.
    Author:
    Steve Tan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ResourcePoint(java.lang.String baseUrl)
      Constructs a resource point with a default StringResponseParser.
      ResourcePoint(java.lang.String baseUrl, java.lang.Class<T> resourceClass)
      Constructs a resource point that uses a GsonResponseParser to parse an object of the specified resource class.
      ResourcePoint(java.lang.String baseUrl, ResponseParser<T> responseParser)
      Constructs a resource point with a custom ResponseParser.
      ResourcePoint(java.lang.String baseUrl, java.lang.String skeletonResourcePath)
      Constructs a resource point with a default StringResponseParser.
      ResourcePoint(java.lang.String baseUrl, java.lang.String skeletonResourcePath, java.lang.Class<T> resourceClass)
      Constructs a resource point that uses a GsonResponseParser to parse an object of the specified resource class.
      ResourcePoint(java.lang.String baseUrl, java.lang.String skeletonResourcePath, ResponseParser<T> responseParser)
      Constructs a resource point with a custom ResponseParser.

      • ResourcePoint

        public ResourcePoint(java.lang.String baseUrl,
             java.lang.Class<T> resourceClass)
        Constructs a resource point that uses a GsonResponseParser to parse an object of the specified resource class.
        Parameters:
        baseUrl - API base URL.
        resourceClass - Resource class of the response object.

      • ResourcePoint

        public ResourcePoint(java.lang.String baseUrl,
             java.lang.String skeletonResourcePath)
        Constructs a resource point with a default StringResponseParser.
        Parameters:
        baseUrl - API base URL.
        skeletonResourcePath - Skeleton resource path is a resource path with placeholders that you can replace with actual values during runtime. The path should be relative to the API base URL.
        For example:
        /user/{{ userId }}
        The default getResourcePath(java.util.Map) method is expecting placeholders in the following format:
        {{ placeholderIdentifier }}
        getResourcePath(java.util.Map) will replace the placeholders with provided parameters.

      • ResourcePoint

        public ResourcePoint(java.lang.String baseUrl,
             java.lang.String skeletonResourcePath,
             ResponseParser<T> responseParser)
        Constructs a resource point with a custom ResponseParser.
        Parameters:
        baseUrl - API base URL.
        skeletonResourcePath - Skeleton resource path is a resource path with placeholders that you can replace with actual values during runtime. The path should be relative to the API base URL.
        For example:
        /user/{{ userId }}
        The default getResourcePath(java.util.Map) method is expecting placeholders in the following format:
        {{ placeholderIdentifier }}
        getResourcePath(java.util.Map) will replace the placeholders with provided parameters.
        responseParser - ResponseParser for parsing response.

      • ResourcePoint

        public ResourcePoint(java.lang.String baseUrl,
             java.lang.String skeletonResourcePath,
             java.lang.Class<T> resourceClass)
        Constructs a resource point that uses a GsonResponseParser to parse an object of the specified resource class.
        Parameters:
        baseUrl - API base URL.
        skeletonResourcePath - Skeleton resource path is a resource path with placeholders that you can replace with actual values during runtime. The path should be relative to the API base URL.
        For example:
        /user/{{ userId }}
        The default getResourcePath(java.util.Map) method is expecting placeholders in the following format:
        {{ placeholderIdentifier }}
        getResourcePath(java.util.Map) will replace the placeholders with provided parameters.
        resourceClass - Resource class of the response object.

    • Method Detail

      • getResourcePath

        public java.lang.String getResourcePath(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params,
                               java.lang.String encoding)
                                 throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        This function will only process the skeleton resource path if it's valid. Otherwise, the entire skeleton path is passed, as-is, upwards as the URL of this resource point.
        Parameters:
        params - Parameters for filling into the placeholders.
        encoding - Charset to encode the URL parameters in.
        Returns:
        Returns a URN (Uniform Resource Name) reference path that is relative to the API base URL.
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - Thrown when value cannot be encoded.

      • getResourcePath

        public java.lang.String getResourcePath(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params)
                                 throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        This function will only process the skeleton resource path if it's valid. Otherwise, the entire skeleton path is passed, as-is, upwards as the URL of this resource point.
        Uses the default UTF-8 encoding to encode the resource path.
        Parameters:
        params - Parameters for filling into the placeholders.
        Returns:
        Returns a URN (Uniform Resource Name) reference path that is relative to the API base URL.
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - Thrown when value cannot be encoded.

      • setSkeletonResourcePath

        public ResourcePoint<T> setSkeletonResourcePath(java.lang.String skeletonResourcePath)
        Set the skeleton resource path.
        Parameters:
        skeletonResourcePath - Skeleton resource path is a resource path with placeholders that you can replace with actual values during runtime. The path should be relative to the API base URL.
        For example:
        /user/{{ userId }}
        The default getResourcePath(java.util.Map) method is expecting placeholders in the following format:
        {{ placeholderIdentifier }}
        getResourcePath(java.util.Map) will replace the placeholders with provided parameters.
        Returns:
        Returns the updated ResourcePoint.

      • getUrl

        public java.lang.String getUrl(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> resourcePathParams)
                        throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Constructs the URL based on the base URL and resource path provided.
        Parameters:
        resourcePathParams - Map of values for filling into the skeleton resource path.
        Returns:
        Returns a full URI path.
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - Thrown when value cannot be encoded.

      • getUrl

        public java.lang.String getUrl(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> resourcePathParams,
                      java.lang.String encoding)
                        throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Constructs the URL based on the base URL and resource path provided.
        Parameters:
        resourcePathParams - Map of values for filling into the skeleton resource path.
        encoding - Charset to encode the URL parameters in.
        Returns:
        Returns a full URI path.
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - Thrown when value cannot be encoded.

      • getUrl

        public java.lang.String getUrl(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> resourcePathParams,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> urlQueryParams)
                        throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Constructs the URL based on the base URL and resource path provided. If a map of query parameters are provided, a URL query parameter string will be constructed and appended to the URL. UTF-8 is used as the default charset for encoding the URL query parameter string.
        NOTE: Any key/value pair that cannot be encoded properly will be ignored!
        Parameters:
        resourcePathParams - Map of values for filling into the skeleton resource path.
        urlQueryParams - Map of query params.
        Returns:
        Returns a full URI path.
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - Thrown when value cannot be encoded.

      • getUrl

        public java.lang.String getUrl(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> resourcePathParams,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> urlQueryParams,
                      java.lang.String encoding)
                        throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Constructs the URL based on the base URL and resource path provided. If a map of query parameters are provided, a URL query parameter string will be constructed and appended to the URL.
        NOTE: Any key/value pair that cannot be encoded properly will be ignored!
        Parameters:
        resourcePathParams - Map of values for filling into the skeleton resource path.
        urlQueryParams - Map of query params.
        encoding - Charset to encode the URL parameters in.
        Returns:
        Returns a full URI path.
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - Thrown when value cannot be encoded.

      • getResponseParser

        public ResponseParser<T> getResponseParser()
        Response parser is used to parse any successful response. Overide this method in your child class to change to a different response parser.
        By default, a GsonResponseParser is used.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseParser
